<style type="text/css">
.a-stats {
	width: auto;
}
.a-stats a {
	background: #7CA821;
	background-image:-moz-linear-gradient(0% 100% 90deg,#5F8E14,#7CA821);
	background-image:-webkit-gradient(linear,0% 0,0% 100%,from(#7CA821),to(#5F8E14));
	border: 1px solid #5F8E14;
	border-radius:3px;
	color: #CFEA93;
	cursor: pointer;
	display: block;
	font-weight: normal;
	height: 100%;
	-moz-border-radius:3px;
	padding: 7px 0 8px;
	text-align: center;
	text-decoration: none;
	-webkit-border-radius:3px;
	width: 100%;
}
.a-stats a:hover {
	text-decoration: none;
	background-image:-moz-linear-gradient(0% 100% 90deg,#6F9C1B,#659417);
	background-image:-webkit-gradient(linear,0% 0,0% 100%,from(#659417),to(#6F9C1B));
}
.a-stats .count {
	color: #FFF;
	display: block;
	font-size: 15px;
	line-height: 16px;
	padding: 0 13px;
	white-space: nowrap;
}
</style>

<article id="post-4642" class="post-4642 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-cleansing-detox category-longevity-2 tag-alternative-medicine tag-alzheimers-disease tag-amino-acids tag-chelation-therapy tag-edta tag-heavy-metal-poisoning tag-lead tag-mercury tag-naturopathic-therapy">
	
	<header class="entry-header">
				<div class="entry-meta">
			<span class="cat-links"><a href="https://holistichealthliving.wordpress.com/category/cleansing-detox/" rel="category tag">Cleansing / Detox</a>, <a href="https://holistichealthliving.wordpress.com/category/longevity-2/" rel="category tag">Longevity</a></span>
		</div>
		<h1 class="entry-title"><a href="https://holistichealthliving.wordpress.com/2015/06/25/what-is-chelation-therapy/" rel="bookmark">What Is Chelation Therapy?</a></h1>
		<div class="entry-meta">
			<span class="entry-date"><a href="https://holistichealthliving.wordpress.com/2015/06/25/what-is-chelation-therapy/" rel="bookmark"><time class="entry-date" datetime="2015-06-25T17:50:48+00:00">June 25, 2015</time></a></span> <span class="byline"><span class="author vcard"><a class="url fn n" href="https://holistichealthliving.wordpress.com/author/capitalistpigletatt/" rel="author">Syndicated Article</a></span></span>			<span class="comments-link"><a href="https://holistichealthliving.wordpress.com/2015/06/25/what-is-chelation-therapy/#respond">Leave a comment</a></span>
					</div><!-- .entry-meta -->
	</header><!-- .entry-header -->

		<div class="entry-content">
		<p><a href="https://holistichealthliving.files.wordpress.com/2015/06/edta.jpg"><img class="alignleft wp-image-4644" src="https://holistichealthliving.files.wordpress.com/2015/06/edta.jpg?w=250&h=384" alt="EDTA" width="250" height="384" srcset="https://holistichealthliving.files.wordpress.com/2015/06/edta.jpg?w=250&h=384 250w, https://holistichealthliving.files.wordpress.com/2015/06/edta.jpg?w=500&h=768 500w, https://holistichealthliving.files.wordpress.com/2015/06/edta.jpg?w=98&h=150 98w, https://holistichealthliving.files.wordpress.com/2015/06/edta.jpg?w=195&h=300 195w" sizes="(max-width: 250px) 100vw, 250px" /></a>By Longevity Medical</p>
<p>Chelation therapy is a method of medicine that is used to remove excess heavy metals from your bloodstream. This mainly refers to the excess mercury that can often exist inside your blood, which can cause harm to your cells, and therefore your body.</p>
<p>Chelation (pronounced kee-lay-shun) therapy is accomplished by intravenously introducing a chelating agent, Ethylene diamine tetra-acetic acid (EDTA), which is a synthetic amino acid. EDTA grabs onto the heavy metals and harmful minerals in the blood and allows them to be released in your urine. Sometimes another agent is used intravenously for extreme mercury detoxification, called DMPS. There are also oral chelating agents that are taken in pill form, and is an FDA-approved drug used for the treatment of lead poisoning. It is used to remove mercury from the body, combining with the metals in the bloodstream, then the metals and the drug are removed from the body by your kidneys and excreted through your urine.</p>
<p> <a href="https://holistichealthliving.wordpress.com/2015/06/25/what-is-chelation-therapy/#more-4642" class="more-link">Continue reading <span class="screen-reader-text">What Is Chelation Therapy?</span> <span class="meta-nav">→</span></a></p>
	</div><!-- .entry-content -->
	
	<footer class="entry-meta"><span class="tag-links"><a href="https://holistichealthliving.wordpress.com/tag/alternative-medicine/" rel="tag">alternative medicine</a><a href="https://holistichealthliving.wordpress.com/tag/alzheimers-disease/" rel="tag">Alzheimer's disease</a><a href="https://holistichealthliving.wordpress.com/tag/amino-acids/" rel="tag">amino acids</a><a href="https://holistichealthliving.wordpress.com/tag/chelation-therapy/" rel="tag">chelation therapy</a><a href="https://holistichealthliving.wordpress.com/tag/edta/" rel="tag">edta</a><a href="https://holistichealthliving.wordpress.com/tag/heavy-metal-poisoning/" rel="tag">heavy metal poisoning</a><a href="https://holistichealthliving.wordpress.com/tag/lead/" rel="tag">lead</a><a href="https://holistichealthliving.wordpress.com/tag/mercury/" rel="tag">mercury</a><a href="https://holistichealthliving.wordpress.com/tag/naturopathic-therapy/" rel="tag">naturopathic therapy</a></span></footer></article><!-- #post-## -->

<article id="post-4610" class="post-4610 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-cleansing-detox category-lifestyle tag-alternative-health tag-alternative-medicine tag-blood-cleansers tag-detox tag-kidney-health-2 tag-liver-health">
	
	<header class="entry-header">
				<div class="entry-meta">
			<span class="cat-links"><a href="https://holistichealthliving.wordpress.com/category/cleansing-detox/" rel="category tag">Cleansing / Detox</a>, <a href="https://holistichealthliving.wordpress.com/category/lifestyle/" rel="category tag">Lifestyle</a></span>
		</div>
		<h1 class="entry-title"><a href="https://holistichealthliving.wordpress.com/2015/05/28/detox-teas-are-they-helpful-for-detoxification/" rel="bookmark">Detox Teas: Are They Helpful For Detoxification?</a></h1>
		<div class="entry-meta">
			<span class="entry-date"><a href="https://holistichealthliving.wordpress.com/2015/05/28/detox-teas-are-they-helpful-for-detoxification/" rel="bookmark"><time class="entry-date" datetime="2015-05-28T16:10:46+00:00">May 28, 2015</time></a></span> <span class="byline"><span class="author vcard"><a class="url fn n" href="https://holistichealthliving.wordpress.com/author/capitalistpigletatt/" rel="author">Syndicated Article</a></span></span>			<span class="comments-link"><a href="https://holistichealthliving.wordpress.com/2015/05/28/detox-teas-are-they-helpful-for-detoxification/#respond">Leave a comment</a></span>
					</div><!-- .entry-meta -->
	</header><!-- .entry-header -->

		<div class="entry-content">
		<p><a href="https://holistichealthliving.files.wordpress.com/2015/05/detoxtea.jpg"><img class="alignleft size-medium wp-image-4612" src="https://holistichealthliving.files.wordpress.com/2015/05/detoxtea.jpg?w=300&h=300" alt="detoxtea" width="300" height="300" srcset="https://holistichealthliving.files.wordpress.com/2015/05/detoxtea.jpg?w=300&h=300 300w, https://holistichealthliving.files.wordpress.com/2015/05/detoxtea.jpg?w=600&h=600 600w, https://holistichealthliving.files.wordpress.com/2015/05/detoxtea.jpg?w=150&h=150 150w" sizes="(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px" /></a>By Katie Adams</p>
<p>With more and more people putting more concern on their health and wellness, detoxification products such as detox teas are becoming all the more popular.</p>
<p>Why Detoxify? The human body is created with its own detoxification system, which includes the skin, liver, kidney and the colon. The liver and the kidney filter out the toxins in the body which goes out through the urinary system, the digestive system or as sweat through the skin. The body’s waste management system works well under normal circumstances, but given today’s fast paced lifestyle and extensive exposure to waste and toxins, the body can only deal with so much. This brings us to the need to detoxify, or cleanse the body and get rid of toxins and waste.</p>
<p> <a href="https://holistichealthliving.wordpress.com/2015/05/28/detox-teas-are-they-helpful-for-detoxification/#more-4610" class="more-link">Continue reading <span class="screen-reader-text">Detox Teas: Are They Helpful For Detoxification?</span> <span class="meta-nav">→</span></a></p>
	</div><!-- .entry-content -->
	
	<footer class="entry-meta"><span class="tag-links"><a href="https://holistichealthliving.wordpress.com/tag/alternative-health/" rel="tag">alternative health</a><a href="https://holistichealthliving.wordpress.com/tag/alternative-medicine/" rel="tag">alternative medicine</a><a href="https://holistichealthliving.wordpress.com/tag/blood-cleansers/" rel="tag">Blood cleansers</a><a href="https://holistichealthliving.wordpress.com/tag/detox/" rel="tag">detox</a><a href="https://holistichealthliving.wordpress.com/tag/kidney-health-2/" rel="tag">kidney health</a><a href="https://holistichealthliving.wordpress.com/tag/liver-health/" rel="tag">liver health</a></span></footer></article><!-- #post-## -->

		<h1 class="entry-title"><a href="https://holistichealthliving.wordpress.com/2015/03/28/the-benefits-of-ayurvedic-medicine-ashoka/" rel="bookmark">The Benefits of Ayurvedic Medicine: Ashoka</a></h1>
		<div class="entry-meta">
			<span class="entry-date"><a href="https://holistichealthliving.wordpress.com/2015/03/28/the-benefits-of-ayurvedic-medicine-ashoka/" rel="bookmark"><time class="entry-date" datetime="2015-03-28T00:12:29+00:00">March 28, 2015</time></a></span> <span class="byline"><span class="author vcard"><a class="url fn n" href="https://holistichealthliving.wordpress.com/author/ardentleo/" rel="author">apothecary21c / Andrea Lewis</a></span></span>			<span class="comments-link"><a href="https://holistichealthliving.wordpress.com/2015/03/28/the-benefits-of-ayurvedic-medicine-ashoka/#respond">Leave a comment</a></span>
					</div><!-- .entry-meta -->
	</header><!-- .entry-header -->

		<div class="entry-content">
		<figure data-shortcode="caption" id="attachment_4448" style="width: 350px" class="wp-caption alignleft"><a href="https://holistichealthliving.wordpress.com/2015/03/28/the-benefits-of-ayurvedic-medicine-ashoka/saraca_asoca/#main" rel="attachment wp-att-4448"><img class="wp-image-4448" src="https://holistichealthliving.files.wordpress.com/2015/03/saraca_asoca.jpg?w=350&h=243" alt="saraca_asoca" width="350" height="243" srcset="https://holistichealthliving.files.wordpress.com/2015/03/saraca_asoca.jpg?w=350&h=243 350w, https://holistichealthliving.files.wordpress.com/2015/03/saraca_asoca.jpg?w=700&h=486 700w, https://holistichealthliving.files.wordpress.com/2015/03/saraca_asoca.jpg?w=150&h=104 150w, https://holistichealthliving.files.wordpress.com/2015/03/saraca_asoca.jpg?w=300&h=209 300w" sizes="(max-width: 350px) 100vw, 350px" /></a><figcaption class="wp-caption-text">Saraca Asoca flowers and leaves</figcaption></figure>
<p>Ashoka (saraca asoca/saraca indica) is the oldest known species of tree in India and is considered sacred in the Hindu faith; it’s name means “without sorrow” or “that which gives no grief” in Sanskrit. This evergreen is regarded as a universal panacea in Ayurvedic medicine, and with good reason. Ashoka is not only used as an individual Ayurvedic remedy, for a variety of ailments, but as part of synergistic blends and in pharmaceutical drug formulations as well. For the sake of brevity, I will only discuss the most documented health benefits associated with this legendary herb. …</p>
<p>This article has been updated and moved to the new Holistic Health & Living at <a href="http://www.holistichealthliving.com/2015/09/the-benefits-of-ayurvedic-medicine-ashoka/" rel="nofollow">http://www.holistichealthliving.com/2015/09/the-benefits-of-ayurvedic-medicine-ashoka/</a></p>

		<h1 class="entry-title"><a href="https://holistichealthliving.wordpress.com/2013/05/22/the-importance-of-fiber-for-health-well-being/" rel="bookmark">The Importance of Fiber for Health & Well-Being</a></h1>
		<div class="entry-meta">
			<span class="entry-date"><a href="https://holistichealthliving.wordpress.com/2013/05/22/the-importance-of-fiber-for-health-well-being/" rel="bookmark"><time class="entry-date" datetime="2013-05-22T15:00:03+00:00">May 22, 2013</time></a></span> <span class="byline"><span class="author vcard"><a class="url fn n" href="https://holistichealthliving.wordpress.com/author/ardentleo/" rel="author">apothecary21c / Andrea Lewis</a></span></span>			<span class="comments-link"><a href="https://holistichealthliving.wordpress.com/2013/05/22/the-importance-of-fiber-for-health-well-being/#comments">6 Comments</a></span>
					</div><!-- .entry-meta -->
	</header><!-- .entry-header -->

		<div class="entry-content">
		<figure data-shortcode="caption" id="attachment_3666" style="width: 310px" class="wp-caption alignleft"><a href="https://holistichealthliving.wordpress.com/?attachment_id=3666" rel="attachment wp-att-3666"><img class="size-medium wp-image-3666" src="https://holistichealthliving.files.wordpress.com/2013/05/fiber_rich_foods.jpg?w=300&h=199" alt="Fiber rich foods" width="300" height="199" srcset="https://holistichealthliving.files.wordpress.com/2013/05/fiber_rich_foods.jpg?w=300&h=199 300w, https://holistichealthliving.files.wordpress.com/2013/05/fiber_rich_foods.jpg?w=150&h=100 150w, https://holistichealthliving.files.wordpress.com/2013/05/fiber_rich_foods.jpg 425w" sizes="(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px" /></a><figcaption class="wp-caption-text">Fiber rich foods</figcaption></figure>
<p>When most people hear the word “fiber” they think of bowel health; they imagine something that can alleviate constipation and prevent colon cancer. … Which is partially true. However, fiber is also beneficial for preventing heart disease and diabetes, helping you maintain a healthy weight, and even protecting the brain and improving mood.</p>
<p><b>There are two kinds of Dietary Fiber</b></p>
<p><b>Soluble Fiber</b> – which dissolves in water, is useful for lowering LDL (“bad”) cholesterol and blood glucose levels, by interfering with cholesterol absorption and increasing insulin sensitivity. It also helps with weight loss, because it slows digestion, making you feel fuller longer.</p>
<p><b>Insoluble Fiber</b> – which does not dissolve in water, is best for cleansing the bowels. It remains intact and adds bulk to your stools, by binding together the bits of digested food in your small intestines as they move along to the colon, while also drawing water to the stool to make it softer and easier to pass.</p>
<p> <a href="https://holistichealthliving.wordpress.com/2013/05/22/the-importance-of-fiber-for-health-well-being/#more-3664" class="more-link">Continue reading <span class="screen-reader-text">The Importance of Fiber for Health & Well-Being</span> <span class="meta-nav">→</span></a></p>
	</div><!-- .entry-content -->

<article id="post-3487" class="post-3487 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-cleansing-detox category-herbs tag-alternative tag-ayurveda tag-bile tag-curcumin tag-detoxification tag-fasting-and-cleansing tag-health tag-triphala">
	
	<header class="entry-header">
				<div class="entry-meta">
			<span class="cat-links"><a href="https://holistichealthliving.wordpress.com/category/cleansing-detox/" rel="category tag">Cleansing / Detox</a>, <a href="https://holistichealthliving.wordpress.com/category/herbs/" rel="category tag">Herbs</a></span>
		</div>
		<h1 class="entry-title"><a href="https://holistichealthliving.wordpress.com/2013/01/19/detox-diet-with-ayurvedic-herbs/" rel="bookmark">Detox Diet With Ayurvedic Herbs</a></h1>
		<div class="entry-meta">
			<span class="entry-date"><a href="https://holistichealthliving.wordpress.com/2013/01/19/detox-diet-with-ayurvedic-herbs/" rel="bookmark"><time class="entry-date" datetime="2013-01-19T12:00:03+00:00">January 19, 2013</time></a></span> <span class="byline"><span class="author vcard"><a class="url fn n" href="https://holistichealthliving.wordpress.com/author/capitalistpigletatt/" rel="author">Syndicated Article</a></span></span>			<span class="comments-link"><a href="https://holistichealthliving.wordpress.com/2013/01/19/detox-diet-with-ayurvedic-herbs/#comments">2 Comments</a></span>
					</div><!-- .entry-meta -->
	</header><!-- .entry-header -->

		<div class="entry-content">
		<p><a href="https://holistichealthliving.wordpress.com/?attachment_id=3488" rel="attachment wp-att-3488"><img class="alignleft size-full wp-image-3488" alt="curcumin" src="https://holistichealthliving.files.wordpress.com/2013/01/curcumin.jpg?w=474" srcset="https://holistichealthliving.files.wordpress.com/2013/01/curcumin.jpg 300w, https://holistichealthliving.files.wordpress.com/2013/01/curcumin.jpg?w=120 120w, https://holistichealthliving.files.wordpress.com/2013/01/curcumin.jpg?w=240 240w" sizes="(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px"   /></a>By Sandra Kim Leong</p>
<p><a class="zem_slink" title="Ayurvedic Herbs As Holistic Medication" href="https://holistichealthliving.wordpress.com/2011/09/01/ayurvedic-herbs-as-holistic-medication/" target="_blank" rel="wikipedia">Ayurvedic</a> herbs have long been used for detoxification and cleansing. They were used in ancient India but increasingly, they are becoming more popular as more people discover about their healing properties. For detoxification, there are certain Ayurvedic herbs that aid in liver cleansing. These herbs can be easily added to your <a class="zem_slink" title="Blood Cleansing Herbs" href="https://holistichealthliving.wordpress.com/2012/10/18/blood-cleansing-herbs/" target="_blank" rel="wikipedia">detox diet</a>.</p>
<p>The liver is an important organ where your body wastes are eliminated. These body wastes then turn into <a class="zem_slink" title="Bile" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bile" target="_blank" rel="wikipedia">bile</a> which comprises of metabolic waste and other toxins that are filtered out from the liver. The bile then goes to the gallbladder and to the intestines where fats are broken down. It also becomes a lubricating agent that prepares the body for bowel movement.</p>
<p>Ayurvedic herbs such as <a class="zem_slink" title="Ayurvedic Tips For Good Digestion" href="https://holistichealthliving.wordpress.com/2010/03/01/ayurvedic-tips-for-good-digestion/" target="_blank" rel="wikipedia">Triphala</a> and <a class="zem_slink" title="Curcumin" href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Curcumin" target="_blank" rel="wikipedia">Curcumin</a> can help to jumpstart the production of bile. Curcumin is an active compound for bile production. Being an antioxidant, it doubles up the normal production of the bile, thus results to a more efficient bowel movement and excretion of body waste. You should expect that as dietary toxins are eliminated in a more frequent manner, you would become healthier.</p>
<p>Triphala is also used as treatment for gastrointestinal conditions and improves digestion. It increases bile excretion and keeps cholesterol at a normal level. It is also a potent antioxidant that fights free radical.</p>
<p>For thorough cleansing, an individualized detoxification regime involving Ayurvedic herbs can take as long as 45 days. You should however not fast or skip on your liquid diets as this may create an imbalance. Instead, you would need to avoid foods that may clog up your waste channels. Such foods are usually very hard to digest and add to your constipation problems. These include frozen, packed, canned and processed foods.</p>
<p>Ayurvedic herbs work best when added to fresh foods that promotes digestion. Examples of such foods are organic vegetables and fruits, soups and flat breads. To prepare for a detox diet that uses Ayurvedic herbs, you should first go on normal meals that include leafy green vegetables like Brussels sprouts and cabbage. Light grains are also recommended like barley, quinoa and small servings of rice. You also need to drink plenty of warm water to flush out toxins through the process of urination.</p>
<p>If you intend to adopt a detox diet, consider including Ayurvedic herbs. They can help in the removal of toxic waste from your body and can greatly improve your health and enhance your energy levels.</p>
